H3516.def: = state in which an object has relatively much weight, ≈ which is often associated with slowness, functioning with difficulty, but also with importance, riches, status, etc.

H7151.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H346.def: = a reference to an unknown location; normally used with the purpose of finding out which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found

H1715.def: = seeds of cultivated cereal; ► used as food

H3196.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex{N:001}

H2491.def: = state in which humans or animal are fatally wounded with a sharp object

H7339.def: = central part of a city where people meet and where civic and commercial activities take place, usually at the intersection of streets and roads

H8210.def: = causative action by which humans pour out a liquid or dry substance

H2436.def: = front of the body of a human being, which, when a person is sitting down, forms a kind of platform that can be used for activities like throwing the lot, and that can even function as a sitting place for someone else, like a pet animal, a child or a beloved one; ≈ symbolizes affection and intimacy, and sometimes represents the entire person

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H5749.def: = action with which a person gives evidence or proof of something, often as a witness in a legal setting ► the witness can be favorable or unfavorable

H1819.def: = process by which part of the body is reduced to inactivity

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H7495.def: = causative action by which humans or deities help or cause (other) humans or animals to be restored to health or physical strength after a disease or an accident; this could also refer to the wound or disease itself; ≈ often used figuratively to denote the state of a country or nation suffering from the consequences of their unfaithfulness

H2372.def: = process by which someone perceives an important object with the eyes, or witnesses an event of some significance

H5030.def: = male person speaking on behalf of a deity

H7723.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H8602.def: = food that does not have much taste ◄ due to the lack of salt

H1540.def: = action by which someone takes off his/her clothes, either entirely or in part, ► as a result of which that person becomes naked or improperly dressed, ≈ which is considered a shameful thing to do

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H4853.def: literally: lifting up (one's) self; hence: = action by which humans turn to (other) humans with the confidence that they will find joy and comfort there

H4065.def: = causative action by which humans cause other humans to give up a certain pattern of behavior and start engaging in other activities which are usually regarded as unacceptable

26.gl: to restore the fortunes (of a nation)

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

H5128.def: = process by which objects move up and down or sideways

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3632.def: = state in which an object has been affected by an event in its entirety

H3308.def: = state in which the outward appearance of humans or objects is pleasing to the eye

H4885.def: poetic term; = state in which humans, deities, and animals feel and show great joy

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H2786.def: = to gnash or grind one's teeth עַל with regard to someone else ► in order to express one's hostility

H1104.def: = action by which humans or animals cause food to pass down from their mouth to their esophagus; ≈ often used figuratively to denote destruction and death

H389.def: = particle marking a constituent as representing a limited number of entities

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H6726.def: = mountain; ► that part of {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>} on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, YHWH's dwelling place

H1832.def: = fluid appearing in the eye; ≈ primarily associated with grief and mourning

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.
